title: Current - relate 2 wire currents from Q-vs-t graph

content.question: The graph shows the cumulative amount of charge moving past a cross section in each of two wires, Wire <math alttext="X" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mtext>X</mtext></math> and Wire <math alttext="Y" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi mathvariant="normal">Y</mi></math>, as a function of time. The currents <math alttext="I sub X" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>I</mi><mi mathvariant="normal">X</mi></msub></math> and <math alttext="I sub Y" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>I</mi><mi mathvariant="normal">Y</mi></msub></math> in wires <math alttext="X" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi mathvariant="normal">X</mi></math> and <math alttext="Y" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi mathvariant="normal">Y</mi></math>, respectively, are both constant during the time interval indicated in the graph, although they may or may not be constant outside of this time interval. Which of the following relations is correct for <math alttext="I sub X" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>I</mi><mi mathvariant="normal">X</mi></msub></math> and <math alttext="I sub Y" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>I</mi><mi mathvariant="normal">Y</mi></msub></math>?

choices.label: <math alttext="I sub X, is greater than open parenthesis, I sub Y equals 0, close parenthesis" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><msub><mi>I</mi><mtext>X</mtext></msub><mo>></mo><mrow><mo>(</mo><msub><mi>I</mi><mtext>Y</mtext></msub><mo>=</mo><mn>0</mn><mo>)</mo></mrow></mstyle></math>

<math alttext="I sub X, is greater than I sub Y, which is greater than 0" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><msub><mi>I</mi><mtext>X</mtext></msub><mo>></mo><msub><mi>I</mi><mtext>Y</mtext></msub><mo>></mo><mn>0</mn></mstyle></math>

<math alttext="I sub Y, is greater than open parenthesis, I sub X equals 0, close parenthesis" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><msub><mi>I</mi><mtext>Y</mtext></msub><mo>></mo><mrow><mo>(</mo><msub><mi>I</mi><mtext>X</mtext></msub><mo>=</mo><mn>0</mn><mo>)</mo></mrow></mstyle></math>

<math alttext="I sub Y, is greater than I sub X, which is greater than 0" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><msub><mi>I</mi><mtext>Y</mtext></msub><mo>></mo><msub><mi>I</mi><mtext>X</mtext></msub><mo>></mo><mn>0</mn></mstyle></math>

content.answer: <math alttext="I sub Y, is greater than open parenthesis, I sub X equals 0, close parenthesis" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><msub><mi>I</mi><mtext>Y</mtext></msub><mo>></mo><mrow><mo>(</mo><msub><mi>I</mi><mtext>X</mtext></msub><mo>=</mo><mn>0</mn><mo>)</mo></mrow></mstyle></math>

skill.text: 2.C: Compare physical quantities between two or more scenarios or at different times and locations in a single scenario.
